metadata.notes: A classic homiletic style emphasizing personal testimony over dogma, yet utilizing strong rhetorical pressure.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. 0 = Very dominant Critical Parent.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The preacher shifts into a harsh, judgmental CP when addressing 'faultfinders' or those with 'narrow' religion, using shaming language to enforce a specific emotional state.
quotes: If you can't speak a good word, shut up, go somewhere, and pray
It is the smallest, narrowest, cheapest religion
I despise Mr. Fear-all and his wife, Mrs. We-Can't

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. 0 = Absent or smothering.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: The NP is present in the promises of God's power to heal and lift, though it occasionally veers into 'rescuing' by over-simplifying complex human suffering.
quotes: Our hurts exist to show God's power to heal them.
God even accommodates himself to our poor, dim understanding.

adult.analysis: The preacher uses the Adult to process the biblical text and historical context, but quickly abandons objective analysis for emotional and moral imperatives.
quotes: Those who make a study of such things tell us that we have some six instances of blindness...
You are examining me on matters about which I am not competent.

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. 0 = Strong Adapted Child (fear culture).
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The congregation is pressured to adapt to a 'bright and cheerful spirit' or face the preacher's 'despising' of their fear/doubt.
quotes: These of whom I speak have shamed most of us by their bright and cheerful spirit
Ask God to bring you to a radiant hopefulness

free_child_FC.analysis: The preacher exhibits a high degree of Free Child energy—spontaneous, rhythmic, and poetic—inviting the listener into a shared 'thrill' of the miraculous.
quotes: Mightn't a preacher gloriously halt right there and thrill to the significance
found us way down and lifted us way up

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher primarily addresses the congregation from a Parent position (both Nurturing and Critical), inviting the congregation to respond as the Adapted Child (either through shamed compliance or joyful imitation).
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: The social message is 'God is good,' but the psychological message is 'You are inadequate if you are not constantly optimistic.'
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The 'double bottom' lies in the promise of healing (NP) which carries the hidden threat of being labeled a 'faultfinder' (CP) if the healing isn't immediately celebrated.

detected_games.name: NIGYSOB (Now I've Got You, You Son of a Bitch)

formula_g_analysis.con: Inviting the listener to reflect on their own burdens.
formula_g_analysis.gimmick: The listener's natural tendency toward doubt or 'fear' during hardship.
formula_g_analysis.switch: The preacher suddenly attacks these natural feelings as 'cheap religion' and 'ice-water throwing'.
formula_g_analysis.payoff: The preacher feels superior/righteous; the listener feels guilty/shamed.

evidence_quotes: I despise Mr. Fear-all and his wife, Mrs. We-Can't

detected_games.name: ITHY (I'm Only Trying To Help You)

formula_g_analysis.con: Offering a simple solution: 'God is able'.
formula_g_analysis.switch: If the listener doesn't feel better, it's because they are a 'pessimist' or 'habitual faultfinder'.
formula_g_analysis.payoff: The preacher maintains the 'Rescuer' status; the listener is blamed for the failure of the 'help'.

evidence_quotes: Our problems exist to show God's power to solve them.
If you can't speak a good word, shut up

preacher_roles.rescuer: High. Positions himself as the one bringing the 'radiant hopefulness' to the 'dim understanding' of the congregation.
preacher_roles.persecutor: High. Aggressively attacks the 'faultfinders' and 'ice-water throwers' (anyone who doubts).
preacher_roles.victim: Low. Only briefly mentions the 'load' of the church burning, but quickly moves to Persecutor of the man who doubted.

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: Pushed into the Victim role (needing rescue from blindness/sorrow) or the Persecutor role (if they dare to be critical).
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: The sermon offers an escape into 'Experience' (Free Child), but it is a conditional autonomy—you are only 'free' if you are 'radiant'.

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: The sermon is rhetorically powerful but psychologically coercive. It uses a 'Bait and Switch' dynamic where the beauty of grace is used to shame those who struggle with doubt or depression. By labeling natural human fear as 'cheap religion,' it creates a culture of forced optimism (Adapted Child) rather than authentic faith.
strengths: High Free Child energy creates a sense of vitality and hope.
Strong use of the Adult ego to defend the blind man's right to his own experience.
areas_for_improvement: Heavy reliance on Critical Parent shaming ('shut up').
Binary thinking: you are either 'radiant' or a 'faultfinder'.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Move from CP to Adult when discussing doubt. Instead of 'despising' fear, use the Adult to explore why fear exists and how the 'Authority of Experience' can coexist with honest struggle.
